page.title: 08"LITTLE GERMANY", BRADFORD
page.content:
On the hillslope between Leeds Road and Church Bank stands {"Little {Germany"}- a collection of export stuff and yarn warehouses built between 1856 and 1874.
Vicar Lane which bisects the area is {architecturally one of the most {striking streets of Victorian Britain. Here such men as Eli Milnes, Lockwood, Mawson, Andrews, Pepper, France, Delauney and Morley designed buildings in various styles with a range of {impressive entrances} for their merchant clients.
They stand as monuments to the thriving wool trade which Bradford had with Germany, Russia and the USA in the 1870's.
